title: TASHI PALDEN GONPA
actName: Under Notificiation No 2602 A/H dated 125.3.1960 of Law Department Government of Sikkim
detailsOfAchievement: The major activities of this monastery is impart Buddhist teachings and ritualistic studies to young monks of the monastery. This is maintly to preserve the Buddhist culture and traditions. Right from the admission in the monastery, the young monks are taught to read and write. They are also taught to play musical instruments and other Buddhist arts. While at the monastery the students learn to make butter sculptures and necessary ritualistic arts. They are guided by very aged Masters.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Contribution made by the members and the devotees of the monastery
The members and the devotees contributes for the regular fund and maintenance of the monastery. There is no other source from any agency.

address: ODC Gonjang Monastery Bhojoghari, Gangtok East Sikkim Pin 737103
title: THE TINGKYE GONJANG NYINGMA TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: The Institute provides opportunity to study Buddhist Science and philosophical text written by the seventeen great Nalanda Pandits, and their commentaries by Tibetan Scholars to the students. Besides, we taught our students English, astrology. The Institute has eight teachers and 125 in house monks. the Institute has its own medical Clinics which provides free checkups medication to the students and local people.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The monastery runs with the offerings made by the devotees and by conducting. puja, rituals etc.

The monastery runs with the offerings made by the devotees and by conducting. puja, rituals etc. People consulting Tibetan medicine at the monastery offer donations for the monastery. The monastery also have rentals as an income.
The monastery runs with the offerings made by the devotees and by conducting. puja, rituals etc.

The monastery runs with the offerings made by the devotees and by conducting. puja, rituals, etc. People consulting Tibetan medicine at the monastery offer donations for the monastery. The monastery also has rentals as an income. Also the Rimpoche of the monastery supports the Institute.
